description: News about Four-Star Restaurants (NYC). Commentary and archival information about Four-Star Restaurants (NYC) from The New York Times.
title: Four-Star Restaurants in New York
title_page: Four-Star Restaurants in New York - The New York Times
text:
Only a handful of New York restaurants have been awarded four stars by the The New York Times, the highest designation in The Timesâ€™s rating system. The five restaurants that currently have four stars are Del Posto, Eleven Madison Park, Jean-Georges, Le Bernardin and Sushi Nakazawa, the most recent addition to the list, reviewed by Pete Wells in 2013.
On Jan. 12, 2016, Per Se, which was awarded four stars by Frank Bruni in 2004 and by Sam Sifton in 2011, was reviewed by Mr. Wells, who gave it two stars. Daniel, which received four stars from William Grimes in 2001 and from Mr. Bruni in 2009, was re-reviewed in 2013 by Mr. Wells, who gave it three stars.
